intro: Phyllanthus pacificus, commonly known as the Pacific phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific islands. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal or disturbed habitats, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, facilitating its dispersal by wind or water. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
